intro: Calyptranthes iraiensis, commonly known as the Iraí Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Iraí in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture. Calyptranthes iraiensis is adapted to grow in coastal areas and is often found in humid, tropical climates.
